subject: deviced: Separate hall, buzzer and sim features from core logic
commitMessage:
deviced: Separate hall, buzzer and sim features from core logic

Features of Deviced:
	- Common
	- Battery
	- Buzzer
	- Camera led
	- Display
	- Extcon
	- Hall
	- Sdcard
	- Sim
	- Usb
	- Vibrator

Change-Id: I3ee600d299ca1422ac113bc9d91217a8164c162b
Signed-off-by: jy910.yun <jy910.yun@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

The package fails to build for Tizen:Common x86_64 with a number (14 to be precise) of errors like this:

 [  605s] /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/deviced-1.0.0/src/core/device-change-handler.c:722:9: error: cast from pointer to integer of different size [-Werror=pointer-to-int-cast]
 [  605s]   done = (int)data;

at the following locations in the code

 src/libdeviced/haptic.c:207:19
 src/libdeviced/haptic.c:301:20
 src/libdeviced/haptic.c:463:20
 src/core/device-notifier.c:124:9
 src/core/launch.c:43:9
 src/core/device-change-handler.c:527:38
 src/core/device-change-handler.c:534:19
 src/core/device-change-handler.c:722:9
 src/power/power-handler.c:210:14
 src/power/power-handler.c:276:9
 src/power/power-handler.c:356:43
 src/power/power-handler.c:363:43
 src/power/power-handler.c:520:19
 src/power/power-handler.c:522:18

Casting pointer to 32-bit integer does not work works on 64-bit architectures and it will fail on Aarch64, most probably, too. Please prepare a separate patch to fix these problems.

I will +1 this patch as soon as there is you upload the fix for int/pointer issues.

Patch Set 4:

Hi Lukasz, I'm fixing some build errors on 64bit build machine. But I think it takes some time. So I suggest to merge it first. As you know, the issue you commented is not related with this patch. Thank you.
Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: deviced: Fix wrong rpm dependencies
commitMessage:
deviced: Fix wrong rpm dependencies

Libsysman, libslp-pm, libdevman should be in need of deviced library.
Because those library invoke libdeviced function internally.
In contrast, libhaptic does not have any dependency with deviced library.

Change-Id: I1f2f2640f19c44f0024ffc7687014469fb202c2e
Signed-off-by: Jiyoung Yun <jy910.yun@samsung.com>

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: deviced: Fix wrong type cast on 64bit build machine
commitMessage:
deviced: Fix wrong type cast on 64bit build machine

Deviced sometimes pass int value to void * value.
It occurs warning on 64bit build machine
so I fixed wrong type cast from int to 64bit value.

Change-Id: If68a26d5911b803a0793488da64fd22fd1d92867
Signed-off-by: Jiyoung Yun <jy910.yun@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Seems OK in general. Please address the issues in the comments.

Patch Set 2:

@Lukasz Stelmach Thank you for your advice. I added some comments.

Patch Set 3:

why don't you use intptr_t casting?

Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

I also recommend to use intptr_t instead of long type casting.

Patch Set 4: Verified+1

I'm for your comments so i fixed it to use intptr_t instead of long type. Thank you.

Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

I am no too convinced with that intptr_t.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: deviced: Remove haptic build errors on 64bit build machine
commitMessage:
deviced: Remove haptic build errors on 64bit build machine

The haptic handle need to be passed to other process by dbus
at that time it should typecast void * to int.
To avoid it, change the type of haptic handle to int.
Handle will be managed by unique id instead of memory address.

Signed-off-by: Jiyoung Yun <jy910.yun@samsung.com>
Change-Id: I6db6d11aae0eff50b2ca0f1aed4718a63faf1a4f

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Removing the haptic library in Tizen:Common is not good idea because you'll need them for other profiles. How can you provide the libraries selectively for each profiles? IMO you would better to split the libraries according to below or any other mechanism:

%if %{profile} == "mobile"

Patch Set 2:

with few more work you could solve the following problems now:
 - treat the overflow
 - ensure that the generated id is unique

This 2 questions are very theoretical because 2 power 31 is huge but...

Patch Set 2:

@José Bollo I'm for your comments but I need more time to think how to create unique id effectively. So I wrote down *TODO*. I will update new patch in consideration of your comments soon. Thank you!
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: deviced: Separate battery feature from core logic
commitMessage:
deviced: Separate battery feature from core logic

Disable the battery feature by default
Add functions to register udev monitor filter at run-time
to separate battery logic from core uevent logic

Change-Id: Ic9d6742c7190cf0e456a9efe043b478d1936839b
Signed-off-by: jy910.yun <jy910.yun@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Comment is not good. 
before: Default disable the battery feature
after: Disable the battery feature by default ??
I think that someone else have to approve the patches.

Patch Set 3:

sizeof is okay for static strings. personnally I prefer to use static arrays. See below an example.

const char mystring[] = "mystring";

and strncmp(x, mystring, sizeof mystring)

here sizeof mystring includes the terminating null what is expected I think. 

However, on static stings, strlen("astring") is otpimized by good compilers to be a numeric constant so it is okay but the problem of the terminating null remains.

Patch Set 5: Verified+1

@José Bollo Thanks for your comment! I understand what you are saying. :)
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: deviced: Separate deviced modules for each feature
commitMessage:
deviced: Separate deviced modules for each feature

Deviced can be defined as below features.
	- Common
	- Battery
	- Camera led
	- Display
	- Extcon
	- Sdcard
	- Usb
	- Vibrator

Change-Id: Icb36e4f77c3dd9bc32b5697992c3f33574a54845
Signed-off-by: jy910.yun <jy910.yun@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Verified+1

I'm still removing the dependency among core logic, battery, display and extcon features and I will upload it in next patch.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

According to the thread of the tizen's dev mailing list  https://lists.tizen.org/pipermail/dev/2014-November/004952.html
it would be better to use RPM %bcond macros.

The advantage is that it will then be easier to create products using a project configuration: nothing to change in the spec file, only the OBS configuration.

Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Thank you for comments
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: deviced: Use libdeviced functions inside libdevman and libsysman
commitMessage:
deviced: Use libdeviced functions inside libdevman and libsysman

libdevman and libsysman will be deprecated,
but these library still be used on another modules yet.
And the way to request to deviced is not compatible with recently deviced.
So remove the existing codes and use libdeviced functions.

Change-Id: I4c14e6d640db890cfc9d84fa8b1e0b7d893eb6aa
Signed-off-by: jy910.yun <jy910.yun@samsung.com>

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: deviced: Merge Tizen 2.3 source code into tizen branch
commitMessage:
deviced: Merge Tizen 2.3 source code into tizen branch

Deviced is a new device daemon instead of system-server.
We have a plan to upgrade system-server to deviced.
But there are more than 500 different patches.
Besides some patches in Tizen 2.3 has mobile product features.
And deviced should provide some library which have provided by
system-server to keep compatibility with another modules.
So I merge Tizen 2.3 source code into public branch manually.
(Remove mobile product features and Keep library compatibility)

Signed-off-by: jy910.yun <jy910.yun@samsung.com>
Change-Id: I53d5cfb76ae05c4a240f00cab719e4c699b70592

comments.message: Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased

Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Jiyoung Yun. Do you have a plan to support some option for mobile product features?
IMO, in case of ivi, mobile product features are not necessary.

Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2

We have profile/mobile/ for all git trees that are Mobile specific. Common must be profile agnostic and with a clean git history.

Patch Set 4:

Please consider this patch is the first step to migrate system daemon from system-server to deviced. We'll factorize the feature and clean up mobile specific feature soon for common profile. Before we clean up the code, this code will be baseline.

Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

Since deviced is not in use there's no risk for major regression. Removing -2.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: deviced: Refartoring directory hierarchy
commitMessage:
deviced: Refartoring directory hierarchy

All source directory move into src/.
Most script move into scripts/.
All library directory has a prefix, like lib-.

Signed-off-by: jy910.yun <jy910.yun@samsung.com>
Change-Id: I6e8807f4e67c9e266c1e9067bcab014a0046a6d0

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Please do not move systemd units and README.api to the packaging directory. The general rule for this directory is: put there as little as possible (in the best case there is only spec file because that's where gbs and obs look for it). In case of "upstream" projects we put systemd units and other files we need in Tizen there, because we want to keep the outside of the packaging directory as close to the upstream as possible. In case of our projects, like deviced, we can make those files part of the source tree outside of the packaging directory and this is the correct way.

One file I am not sure where put is deviced.manifest. Please take a look at other Tizen-specific projects.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

deviced is not compliant with Tizen 3 security model which only contains 3 smack domains.
https://wiki.tizen.org/wiki/Security:SmackThreeDomainModel

@Lukasz - manifest file is commonly included in packaging. That will transfer smack labels into rpm metadata in order to  set them at installation time.

There was a proposal to replace system-server by deviced.
I think it is stuck because there is no Jira request for this. What's the status ?

Thanks

Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Thank you for your comments.

I make systemd directory for system units.
And could you give me more advise about manifest ?
Should I change deviced::xxx to system::shared ?
But I have a plan to apply dbus smack for some methods so i should give a domain name more details.

Patch Set 2:

Yes I guess that deviced:xxx smack labels are not good for Tizen 3 security model (Only 3 domains : 'System', 'User' and '_').

I added Casey and José as reviewers, may they can help.

Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

What is packaging/deviced.rule file for? Is it required? I can't find any references to it.

Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Rule file is removed.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

The README.api seems interesting. 
Is a kind of standard or just a memo?
Is there some wiki page about it?

Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

The README.api is just a memo for managing dbus smack authority. But i think this file is not needed in tizen 3.0 because there are only 3 domain according to tizen smack guideline.
So I will remove it and update the manifest file in next patch.

Signed-off-by: jy910.yun <jy910.yun@samsung.com>
Change-Id: I34024294277e517f80e275e4cb222c499f2fba27

subject: Remove hardcoded path for multiuser support
commitMessage:
Remove hardcoded path for multiuser support

Change-Id: I5094dd358fb75fc618a196477725b4227e4d8b6b
Bug-Tizen: PTREL-283
Signed-off-by: Sabera Djelti (sdi2) <sabera.djelti@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: Remove SMACK rule file(.rule) according three domain model
commitMessage:
Remove SMACK rule file(.rule) according three domain model

Since SMACK only allows three labels, "_"(floor), "User", "System"
The labels of current rule file are not appropriate

Solution:
- Remove rule file (packaging/system-server.rule)
- Remove install statement about installing rule file described in CMakeLists.txt
- Remove file path and name declaration of spec file (packaging/system-server.spec)

Reference site
https://wiki.tizen.org/wiki/Security:SmackThreeDomainModel

Change-Id: I55e2e1b34d35b5a8d2dc7328cbc763135663a598
Signed-off-by: seong.chung <seong.chung@samsung.com>

comments.message: Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased
Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Fix package build for Tizen:IVI
commitMessage:
Fix package build for Tizen:IVI

Build of deviced fails for OBS projects with enabled debuginfo and
defined 'simulator' macro with this error:

error: Installed (but unpackaged) file(s) found:
   /usr/lib/debug/.build-id/6e/480d9a978edacf116bd409aa09b97923290f3b
   /usr/lib/debug/.build-id/6e/480d9a978edacf116bd409aa09b97923290f3b.debug
   /usr/lib/debug/usr/bin/restart.debug

The reason of this failure is explained in this bug
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=878863#c2:
Debuginfo generation operates on the disk contents and knows exactly
nothing about specs.

In plain English it means that debuginfo doesn't care about %exclude
statements in %files section of the .spec and processes all binaries,
installed into build root.

This fix removes /usr/bin/restart from buildroot to avoid generation of
debug info for it if 'simulator' macro is defined and includes this binary
into the package only if 'simulator' macro is not defined.

Change-Id: I8368ecc53edb54fb068d394db1abf8d1d73e593a
Signed-off-by: Ed Bartosh <eduard.bartosh@intel.com>

comments.message: Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased

Patch Set 3: Verified+1

nice catch! thank you!
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

You fix more then these 2 errors, so how about generalizing commit message (e.g. 'Fix RPMLINT errors')? Also you need ldconfig should be run for packages that contain .so files, so packages that doesn't ship such files shouldn't have ldconfig in %post.
